info.description: Routing consists of the following service: Calculate Route Calculates a route between an origin and a destination, passing through waypoints (if specified). Additional routing parameters like traffic, avoidance conditions, departure/arrival time etc. can be taken into account. Calculate Reachable Range Calculates a set of locations that can be reached from the origin point, subject to the available fuel or energy budget that is specified in the request.
info.title: Routing

parameters.description: Service version number. The current value is 1.
parameters.name: versionNumber

parameters.description: Point from which the range calculation should start.
parameters.name: origin

parameters.description: The content type of the response structure. If the content type is jsonp, a callback method can be specified in the query parameters.
parameters.name: contentType

parameters.description: Fuel budget in liters. Determines the maximum vehicle range using the specified Combustion Consumption Model.
parameters.name: fuelBudgetInLiters

parameters.description: Electric energy budget in kilowatt hours (kWh). Determines the maximum vehicle range using the specified Electric Consumption Model.
parameters.name: energyBudgetInkWh

parameters.description: Time budget in seconds. Determines the maximum vehicle range using the specified driving time. The consumption parameters in the request will only affect eco-routes, and thereby indirectly the driving time.
parameters.name: timeBudgetInSec

parameters.description: Specifies the jsonp callback method.
parameters.name: callback

parameters.description: Specifies which data should be reported for diagnosis purposes.
parameters.name: report

parameters.description: The date and time of departure from the origin point. Departure times apart from now must be specified as a dateTime.
parameters.name: departAt

parameters.description: The date and time of arrival at the destination point. It must be specified as a dateTime.
parameters.name: arriveAt

parameters.description: The type of route requested.
parameters.name: routeType

parameters.description: Determines whether current traffic is used in route calculations. Note that information on historic road speeds is always used.
parameters.name: traffic

parameters.description:
Specifies whether the routing engine should try to avoid specific types of road segment when calculating the route. Can be specified multiple times.
Possible values:
  - tollRoads
  - motorways
  - ferries
  - unpavedRoads
  - carpools
parameters.name: avoid

parameters.description: The mode of travel for the requested route.
parameters.name: travelMode

parameters.description: Degree of hilliness for calculating a thrilling route.
parameters.name: hilliness

parameters.description: Amount that a thrilling route should wind.
parameters.name: windingness

parameters.description: Maximum speed of the vehicle in km/hour.
parameters.name: vehicleMaxSpeed

parameters.description: Weight of the vehicle in kilograms.
parameters.name: vehicleWeight

parameters.description: Weight per axle of the vehicle in kg.
parameters.name: vehicleAxleWeight

parameters.description: Length of the vehicle in meters.
parameters.name: vehicleLength

parameters.description: Width of the vehicle in meters.
parameters.name: vehicleWidth

parameters.description: Height of the vehicle in meters.
parameters.name: vehicleHeight

parameters.description: Indicates that the vehicle is used for commercial purposes. This means it may not be allowed on certain roads.
parameters.name: vehicleCommercial

parameters.description: Indicates what kinds of hazardous materials the vehicle is carrying (if any). This means it may not be allowed on certain roads. Use these for routing in the US: - USHazmatClass1 Explosives - USHazmatClass2 Compressed gas - USHazmatClass3 Flammable liquids - USHazmatClass4 Flammable solids - USHazmatClass5 Oxidizers - USHazmatClass6 Poisons - USHazmatClass7 Radioactive - USHazmatClass8 Corrosives - USHazmatClass9 Miscellaneous Use these for routing in all other countries: - otherHazmatExplosive Explosives - otherHazmatGeneral Miscellaneous - otherHazmatHarmfulToWater Harmful to water vehicleLoadType can be specified multiple times. This parameter is currently only considered for travelMode=truck.
parameters.name: vehicleLoadType

parameters.description: Specifies the speed-dependent component of consumption. Provided as an unordered list of speed/consumption-rate pairs.
parameters.name: constantSpeedConsumptionInLitersPerHundredkm

parameters.description: Specifies the current supply of fuel in liters.
parameters.name: currentFuelInLiters

parameters.description: Specifies the amount of fuel consumed for sustaining auxiliary systems of the vehicle, in liters per hour.
parameters.name: auxiliaryPowerInLitersPerHour

parameters.description: Specifies the amount of chemical energy stored in one liter of fuel in megajoules (MJ).
parameters.name: fuelEnergyDensityInMJoulesPerLiter

parameters.description: Specifies the efficiency of converting chemical energy stored in fuel to kinetic energy when the vehicle accelerates (i.e. KineticEnergyGained/ChemicalEnergyConsumed).
parameters.name: accelerationEfficiency

parameters.description: Specifies the efficiency of converting kinetic energy to saved (not consumed) fuel when the vehicle decelerates (i.e. ChemicalEnergySaved/KineticEnergyLost).
parameters.name: decelerationEfficiency

parameters.description: Specifies the efficiency of converting chemical energy stored in fuel to potential energy when the vehicle gains elevation (i.e. PotentialEnergyGained/ChemicalEnergyConsumed).
parameters.name: uphillEfficiency

parameters.description: Specifies the efficiency of converting potential energy to saved (not consumed) fuel when the vehicle loses elevation (i.e. ChemicalEnergySaved/PotentialEnergyLost).
parameters.name: downhillEfficiency

parameters.description: Engine type of the vehicle.
parameters.name: vehicleEngineType

parameters.description: Specifies the speed-dependent component of consumption. Provided as an unordered list of speed/consumption-rate pairs.
parameters.name: constantSpeedConsumptionInkWhPerHundredkm

200.description: OK: a range was calculated and the body of the response contains the polygon description and further data.

400.description: Bad request: one or more parameters were incorrectly specified or are mutually exclusive, or the origin point specified in the request is not near enough to a road.

403.description:
Permission, capacity, or authentication issues:
  - Forbidden
  - Not authorized
  - Account inactive
  - Account over queries per second limit
  - Account over rate limit
  - Rate limit exceeded

404.description: Not Found: the requested resource could not be found, but it may be available again in the future.

405.description: Method Not Allowed: the client used a HTTP method other than GET or POST.

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request. Please try again later.

504.description: Internal network connectivity issue or a request that has taken too long to complete.

post.description: Calculates a set of locations that can be reached from the origin point. POST method handles additionally parameters: supportingPoints, allowVignette, avoidVignette, avoidAreas.

parameters.description: Service version number. The current value is 1.
parameters.name: versionNumber

parameters.description: Locations through which the calculated route must pass.
parameters.name: locations

parameters.description: The content type of the response structure. If the content type is jsonp, a callback method can be specified in the query parameters.
parameters.name: contentType

parameters.description: Number of alternative routes to be calculated.
parameters.name: maxAlternatives

parameters.description: Determines whether the alternative routes to be calculated should be better with respect to the planning criteria provided than the reference route.
parameters.name: alternativeType

parameters.description: All alternative routes will follow the reference route for the specified minimum number of meters starting from the origin point.
parameters.name: minDeviationDistance

parameters.description: All alternative routes will follow the reference route for the specified minimum number of seconds starting from the origin point.
parameters.name: minDeviationTime

parameters.description: If specified, guidance instructions will be returned (if available).
parameters.name: instructionsType

parameters.description: The language parameter determines the language of the guidance messages.
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: Re-order the route waypoints to reduce the route length.
parameters.name: computeBestOrder

parameters.description: Specifies the representation of the set of routes provided as a response.
parameters.name: routeRepresentation

parameters.description: Specifies whether to return additional travel times using different types of traffic information (none, historic, live) as well as the default best-estimate travel time.
parameters.name: computeTravelTimeFor

parameters.description: The directional heading of the vehicle in degrees. Entered in degrees, measured clockwise from north (so north is 0, east is 90, etc.).
parameters.name: vehicleHeading

parameters.description:
Specifies which section types are explicitly reported in the route response. Can be specified multiple times.
  - carTrain, ferry, tunnel or motorway
  - pedestrian
  - tollRoad
  - tollVignette
  - country
  - travelMode
  - traffic
parameters.name: sectionType

parameters.description: Specifies the jsonp callback method.
parameters.name: callback

parameters.description: Specifies which data should be reported for diagnosis purposes.
parameters.name: report

parameters.description: The date and time of departure from the origin point. Departure times apart from now must be specified as a dateTime.
parameters.name: departAt

parameters.description: The date and time of arrival at the destination point. It must be specified as a dateTime.
parameters.name: arriveAt

parameters.description: The type of route requested.
parameters.name: routeType

parameters.description: Determines whether current traffic is used in route calculations. Note that information on historic road speeds is always used.
parameters.name: traffic

parameters.description:
Specifies whether the routing engine should try to avoid specific types of road segment when calculating the route. Can be specified multiple times.
Possible values:
  - tollRoads
  - motorways
  - ferries
  - unpavedRoads
  - carpools
  - alreadyUsedRoads
parameters.name: avoid

parameters.description: The mode of travel for the requested route.
parameters.name: travelMode

parameters.description: Degree of hilliness for calculating a thrilling route.
parameters.name: hilliness

parameters.description: Amount that a thrilling route should wind.
parameters.name: windingness

parameters.description: Maximum speed of the vehicle in km/hour.
parameters.name: vehicleMaxSpeed

parameters.description: Weight of the vehicle in kilograms.
parameters.name: vehicleWeight

parameters.description: Weight per axle of the vehicle in kg.
parameters.name: vehicleAxleWeight

parameters.description: Length of the vehicle in meters.
parameters.name: vehicleLength

parameters.description: Width of the vehicle in meters.
parameters.name: vehicleWidth

parameters.description: Height of the vehicle in meters.
parameters.name: vehicleHeight

parameters.description: Indicates that the vehicle is used for commercial purposes. This means it may not be allowed on certain roads.
parameters.name: vehicleCommercial

parameters.description: Indicates what kinds of hazardous materials the vehicle is carrying (if any). This means it may not be allowed on certain roads. Use these for routing in the US: - USHazmatClass1 Explosives - USHazmatClass2 Compressed gas - USHazmatClass3 Flammable liquids - USHazmatClass4 Flammable solids - USHazmatClass5 Oxidizers - USHazmatClass6 Poisons - USHazmatClass7 Radioactive - USHazmatClass8 Corrosives - USHazmatClass9 Miscellaneous Use these for routing in all other countries: - otherHazmatExplosive Explosives - otherHazmatGeneral Miscellaneous - otherHazmatHarmfulToWater Harmful to water vehicleLoadType can be specified multiple times. This parameter is currently only considered for travelMode=truck.
parameters.name: vehicleLoadType

parameters.description: Engine type of the vehicle.
parameters.name: vehicleEngineType

parameters.description: Specifies the speed-dependent component of consumption. Provided as an unordered list of speed/consumption-rate pairs.
parameters.name: constantSpeedConsumptionInLitersPerHundredkm

parameters.description: Specifies the current supply of fuel in liters.
parameters.name: currentFuelInLiters

parameters.description: Specifies the amount of fuel consumed for sustaining auxiliary systems of the vehicle, in liters per hour.
parameters.name: auxiliaryPowerInLitersPerHour

parameters.description: Specifies the amount of chemical energy stored in one liter of fuel in megajoules (MJ).
parameters.name: fuelEnergyDensityInMJoulesPerLiter

parameters.description: Specifies the efficiency of converting chemical energy stored in fuel to kinetic energy when the vehicle accelerates (i.e. KineticEnergyGained/ChemicalEnergyConsumed).
parameters.name: accelerationEfficiency

parameters.description: Specifies the efficiency of converting kinetic energy to saved (not consumed) fuel when the vehicle decelerates (i.e. ChemicalEnergySaved/KineticEnergyLost).
parameters.name: decelerationEfficiency

parameters.description: Specifies the efficiency of converting chemical energy stored in fuel to potential energy when the vehicle gains elevation (i.e. PotentialEnergyGained/ChemicalEnergyConsumed).
parameters.name: uphillEfficiency

parameters.description: Specifies the efficiency of converting potential energy to saved (not consumed) fuel when the vehicle loses elevation (i.e. ChemicalEnergySaved/PotentialEnergyLost).
parameters.name: downhillEfficiency

parameters.name: constantSpeedConsumptionInkWhPerHundredkm

200.description: OK: a route was calculated and the body of the response contains the route description and any other requested data.

400.description: Bad request: one or more parameters were incorrectly specified, are mutually exclusive, the points in the request are not connected by the road network or the points in the request are not near enough to a road.

Permission, capacity, or authentication issues:

504.description: Internal network connectivity issue or a request that has taken too long to complete.

post.description: Calculates a route between an origin and a destination. POST method handles additionally parameters: supportingPoints, allowVignette, avoidVignette, avoidAreas.

accelerationEfficiency.description: Specifies the efficiency of converting chemical energy stored in fuel to kinetic energy when the vehicle accelerates (i.e. KineticEnergyGained/ChemicalEnergyConsumed).
accelerationEfficiency.name: accelerationEfficiency

alternativeType.description: Determines whether the alternative routes to be calculated should be better with respect to the planning criteria provided than the reference route.
alternativeType.name: alternativeType

arriveAt.description: The date and time of arrival at the destination point. It must be specified as a dateTime.
arriveAt.name: arriveAt

auxiliaryPowerInLitersPerHour.description: Specifies the amount of fuel consumed for sustaining auxiliary systems of the vehicle, in liters per hour.
auxiliaryPowerInLitersPerHour.name: auxiliaryPowerInLitersPerHour

auxiliaryPowerInkW.description: Specifies the amount of power consumed by auxiliary systems, in kilowatts (kW).
auxiliaryPowerInkW.name: auxiliaryPowerInkW

avoid.description:
Specifies whether the routing engine should try to avoid specific types of road segment when calculating the route. Can be specified multiple times.
Possible values:
  - tollRoads
  - motorways
  - ferries
  - unpavedRoads
  - carpools
  - alreadyUsedRoads
avoid.name: avoid

avoidInCalculateReachableRange.description:
Specifies whether the routing engine should try to avoid specific types of road segment when calculating the route. Can be specified multiple times.
Possible values:
  - tollRoads
  - motorways
  - ferries
  - unpavedRoads
  - carpools
avoidInCalculateReachableRange.name: avoid

computeBestOrder.description: Re-order the route waypoints to reduce the route length.
computeBestOrder.name: computeBestOrder

computeTravelTimeFor.description: Specifies whether to return additional travel times using different types of traffic information (none, historic, live) as well as the default best-estimate travel time.
computeTravelTimeFor.name: computeTravelTimeFor

constantSpeedConsumptionInLitersPerHundr.description: Specifies the speed-dependent component of consumption. Provided as an unordered list of speed/consumption-rate pairs.
constantSpeedConsumptionInLitersPerHundr.name: constantSpeedConsumptionInLitersPerHundredkm

constantSpeedConsumptionInkWhPerHundredk.description: Specifies the speed-dependent component of consumption. Provided as an unordered list of speed/consumption-rate pairs.
constantSpeedConsumptionInkWhPerHundredk.name: constantSpeedConsumptionInkWhPerHundredkm

contentType.description: The content type of the response structure. If the content type is jsonp, a callback method can be specified in the query parameters.
contentType.name: contentType

currentChargeInkWh.description: Specifies the current electric energy supply in kilowatt hours (kWh).
currentChargeInkWh.name: currentChargeInkWh

currentFuelInLiters.description: Specifies the current supply of fuel in liters.
currentFuelInLiters.name: currentFuelInLiters

decelerationEfficiency.description: Specifies the efficiency of converting kinetic energy to saved (not consumed) fuel when the vehicle decelerates (i.e. ChemicalEnergySaved/KineticEnergyLost).
decelerationEfficiency.name: decelerationEfficiency

departAt.description: The date and time of departure from the origin point. Departure times apart from now must be specified as a dateTime.
departAt.name: departAt

downhillEfficiency.description: Specifies the efficiency of converting potential energy to saved (not consumed) fuel when the vehicle loses elevation (i.e. ChemicalEnergySaved/PotentialEnergyLost).
downhillEfficiency.name: downhillEfficiency

energyBudgetInkWh.description: Electric energy budget in kilowatt hours (kWh). Determines the maximum vehicle range using the specified Electric Consumption Model.
energyBudgetInkWh.name: energyBudgetInkWh

fuelBudgetInLiters.description: Fuel budget in liters. Determines the maximum vehicle range using the specified Combustion Consumption Model.
fuelBudgetInLiters.name: fuelBudgetInLiters

fuelEnergyDensityInMJoulesPerLiter.description: Specifies the amount of chemical energy stored in one liter of fuel in megajoules (MJ).
fuelEnergyDensityInMJoulesPerLiter.name: fuelEnergyDensityInMJoulesPerLiter

hilliness.description: Degree of hilliness for calculating a thrilling route.
hilliness.name: hilliness

instructionsType.description: If specified, guidance instructions will be returned (if available).
instructionsType.name: instructionsType

language.description: The language parameter determines the language of the guidance messages.
language.name: language

locations.description: Locations through which the calculated route must pass.
locations.name: locations

maxAlternatives.description: Number of alternative routes to be calculated.
maxAlternatives.name: maxAlternatives

maxChargeInkWh.description: Specifies the maximum electric energy supply in kilowatt hours (kWh) that may be stored in the vehicle's battery.
maxChargeInkWh.name: maxChargeInkWh

minDeviationDistance.description: All alternative routes will follow the reference route for the specified minimum number of meters starting from the origin point.
minDeviationDistance.name: minDeviationDistance

minDeviationTime.description: All alternative routes will follow the reference route for the specified minimum number of seconds starting from the origin point.
minDeviationTime.name: minDeviationTime

origin.description: Point from which the range calculation should start.
origin.name: origin

report.description: Specifies which data should be reported for diagnosis purposes.
report.name: report

routeRepresentation.description: Specifies the representation of the set of routes provided as a response.
routeRepresentation.name: routeRepresentation

sectionType.description:
Specifies which section types are explicitly reported in the route response. Can be specified multiple times.
  - carTrain, ferry, tunnel or motorway
  - pedestrian
  - tollRoad
  - tollVignette
  - country
  - travelMode
  - traffic
sectionType.name: sectionType

timeBudgetInSec.description: Time budget in seconds. Determines the maximum vehicle range using the specified driving time. The consumption parameters in the request will only affect eco-routes, and thereby indirectly the driving time.
timeBudgetInSec.name: timeBudgetInSec

traffic.description: Determines whether current traffic is used in route calculations. Note that information on historic road speeds is always used.
traffic.name: traffic

travelMode.description: The mode of travel for the requested route.
travelMode.name: travelMode

uphillEfficiency.description: Specifies the efficiency of converting chemical energy stored in fuel to potential energy when the vehicle gains elevation (i.e. PotentialEnergyGained/ChemicalEnergyConsumed).
uphillEfficiency.name: uphillEfficiency

vehicleAxleWeight.description: Weight per axle of the vehicle in kg.
vehicleAxleWeight.name: vehicleAxleWeight

vehicleCommercial.description: Indicates that the vehicle is used for commercial purposes. This means it may not be allowed on certain roads.
vehicleCommercial.name: vehicleCommercial

vehicleHeading.description: The directional heading of the vehicle in degrees. Entered in degrees, measured clockwise from north (so north is 0, east is 90, etc.).
vehicleHeading.name: vehicleHeading

vehicleHeight.description: Height of the vehicle in meters.
vehicleHeight.name: vehicleHeight

vehicleLength.description: Length of the vehicle in meters.
vehicleLength.name: vehicleLength

vehicleLoadType.description: Indicates what kinds of hazardous materials the vehicle is carrying (if any). This means it may not be allowed on certain roads. Use these for routing in the US: - USHazmatClass1 Explosives - USHazmatClass2 Compressed gas - USHazmatClass3 Flammable liquids - USHazmatClass4 Flammable solids - USHazmatClass5 Oxidizers - USHazmatClass6 Poisons - USHazmatClass7 Radioactive - USHazmatClass8 Corrosives - USHazmatClass9 Miscellaneous Use these for routing in all other countries: - otherHazmatExplosive Explosives - otherHazmatGeneral Miscellaneous - otherHazmatHarmfulToWater Harmful to water vehicleLoadType can be specified multiple times. This parameter is currently only considered for travelMode=truck.
vehicleLoadType.name: vehicleLoadType

vehicleMaxSpeed.description: Maximum speed of the vehicle in km/hour.
vehicleMaxSpeed.name: vehicleMaxSpeed

vehicleWeight.description: Weight of the vehicle in kilograms.
vehicleWeight.name: vehicleWeight

vehicleWidth.description: Width of the vehicle in meters.
vehicleWidth.name: vehicleWidth

versionNumber.description: Service version number. The current value is 1.
versionNumber.name: versionNumber

windingness.description: Amount that a thrilling route should wind.
windingness.name: windingness

403.description:
Permission, capacity, or authentication issues:
  - Forbidden
  - Not authorized
  - Account inactive
  - Account over queries per second limit
  - Account over rate limit
  - Rate limit exceeded

404.description: Not Found: the requested resource could not be found, but it may be available again in the future.

405.description: Method Not Allowed: the client used a HTTP method other than GET or POST.

500.description: An error occurred while processing the request. Please try again later.

504.description: Internal network connectivity issue or a request that has taken too long to complete.
